result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Nesbit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC received and filed.  No court action necessary.  SPC.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIXTY (60) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for SEVEN (7) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or school.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.  Consecutive to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Restitution payable to DOLLAR TREE for TWO THOUSAND THIRTY-FOUR DOLLARS AND EIGHTY-FOUR CENTS ($2,034.84) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
VACATE JUDGMENT.  sdg
Apology.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Court continues signature bond previously set.  Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Prior: 5153 North 76th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Joseph S Riepenhoff.  Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court PREVIOUSLY.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that Defendant has completed ONE (1) HOUR of Community Service as of this hearing.  State advised that the Defendant will also need to pay IN EXCESS OF TWO THOUSAND DOLLARS ($2,000.00+).  Defendant advised that he has a plan for completing Restitution.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
(1).  Letter of Apology.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea/dpah in Branch 47  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (9-10-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin A Nesbit in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
